affectingly - in an affecting manner; is a manner to excite emotions.
affection - passion; violent emotion.

alumina - one of the earths, consisting of two parts of aluminium and three of oxygen, al2o3.
aluminate - a compound formed from the hydrate of aluminium by the substitution of a metal for the hydrogen.

fissipedal - having the toes separated to the base. [see aves.]

flunk - a total failure in a recitation.

flutemouth - a fish of the genus aulostoma, having a much elongated tubular snout.
fluter - one who makes grooves or flutings.

flutter - hurry; tumult; agitation of the mind; confusion; disorder.
flutterer - one who, or that which, flutters.
flutteringly - in a fluttering manner.
fluty - soft and clear in tone, like a flute.
fluvial - belonging to rivers; growing or living in streams or ponds; as, a fluvial plant.

fluxive - flowing; also, wanting solidity.

freshes - of fresh

freshening - of freshen
freshen - to grow brisk or strong; as, the wind freshens.
freshet - a flood or overflowing of a stream caused by heavy rains or melted snow; a sudden inundation.

freshment - refreshment.
freshness - the state of being fresh.
fret - to furnish with frets, as an instrument of music.
fretted - interlaced one with another; -- said of charges and ordinaries.
fretting - of fret
fretful - disposed to fret; ill-humored; peevish; angry; in a state of vexation; as, a fretful temper.
frett - the worn side of the bank of a river. see 4th fret, n., 4.
fretten - rubbed; marked; as, pock-fretten, marked with the smallpox.

fretty - adorned with fretwork.
freta - of fretum
fretum - a strait, or arm of the sea.

friable - easily crumbled, pulverized, or reduced to powder.

friary - the institution or praactices of friars.
friation - the act of breaking up or pulverizing.
frible - frivolous; trifling; sily.

frlcassee - to dress like a fricassee.

frickle - a bushel basket.

frictionless - having no friction.

gastriloquous - ventriloquous.
gastriloquy - a voice or utterance which appears to proceed from the stomach; ventriloquy.
gastritis - inflammation of the stomach, esp. of its mucuos membrane.
gastrocnemius - the muscle which makes the greater part of the calf of the leg.
gastrocolic - pertaining to both the stomach and the colon; as, the gastrocolic, or great, omentum.
gastroduodenal - pertaining to the stomach and duodenum; as, the gastroduodenal artery.
gastroduodenitis - inflammation of the stomach and duodenum. it is one of the most frequent causes of jaundice.
gastroenteric - gastrointestinal.
gastroenteritis - inflammation of the lining membrane of the stomach and the intestines.
gastroepiploic - of or pertaining to the stomach and omentum.

gastrolith - see crab's eyes, under crab.
gastrology - the science which treats of the structure and functions of the stomach; a treatise of the stomach.
gastromalacia - a softening of the coats of the stomach; -- usually a post-morten change.
gastromancy - a kind of divination, by means of words seemingly uttered from the stomach.
gastromyces - the fungoid growths sometimes found in the stomach; such as torula, etc.
gastromyth - one whose voice appears to proceed from the stomach; a ventriloquist.

hist - hush; be silent; -- a signal for silence.
histiology - same as histology.
histogenesis - germ history of cells, and of the tissues composed of cells.
histogenetic - tissue-producing; connected with the formation and development of the organic tissues.
histogeny - same as histogenesis.
histographer - one who describes organic tissues; an histologist.
histographical - of or pertaining to histography.
histography - a description of, or treatise on, organic tissues.
histoid - resembling the normal tissues; as, histoid tumors.
histologic - alt. of histological
histological - pertaining to histology, or to the microscopic structure of the tissues of living organisms.
histologist - one versed in histology.
histolysis - the decay and dissolution of the organic tissues and of the blood.
histolytic - of or pertaining to histolysis, or the degeneration of tissues.
histophyly - the tribal history of cells, a division of morphophyly.
historial - historical.
historian - one versed or well informed in history.
historic - alt. of historical
historically - in the manner of, or in accordance with, history.
historicize - to record or narrate in the manner of a history; to chronicle.
historied - related in history.
historier - an historian.
historiette - historical narration on a small scale; a brief recital; a story.
histority - to record in or as history.
historiographership - the office of an historiographer.
historiography - the art of employment of an historiographer.
historiology - a discourse on history.
historionomer - one versed in the phenomena of history and the laws controlling them.
historize - to relate as history; to chronicle; to historicize.
histories - of history
history - to narrate or record.
histotomy - the dissection of organic tissues.
histrion - a player.
histrionic - alt. of histrionical
histrionicism - the histronic art; stageplaying.
histrionism - theatrical representation; acting; affectation.
histrionize - to act; to represent on the stage, or theatrically.
hit - a striking of the ball; as, a safe hit; a foul hit; -- sometimes used specifically for a base hit.
hitting - of hit
hitch - a small dislocation of a bed or vein.
hitched - of hitch
hitching - of hitch
hitchel - see hatchel.
hithe - a port or small haven; -- used in composition; as, lambhithe, now lambeth.
hither - applied to time: on the hither side of, younger than; of fewer years than.
hithermost - nearest on this side.
hitherto - up to this time; as yet; until now.
hitherward - toward this place; hither.
hitter - one who hits or strikes; as, a hard hitter.
hive - to take shelter or lodgings together; to reside in a collective body.
hived - of hive
hiving - of hive
hiveless - destitute of a hive.
hiver - one who collects bees into a hive.
hives - an eruptive disease (varicella globularis), allied to the chicken pox.
hizz - to hiss.

hoa - halloo! attend! -- a call to excite attention, or to give notice of approach.

hoarhound - same as horehound.

hoarsely - with a harsh, grating sound or voice.

hoarsening - of hoarsen
hoarsen - to make hoarse.

hobbyhorse - a stick, often with the head or figure of a horse, on which boys make believe to ride.
hobbyhorsical - pertaining to, or having, a hobby or whim; eccentric; whimsical.

hobit - a small mortar on a gun carriage, in use before the howitzer.

hogringer - one who puts rings into the snouts of hogs.

hogshead - a large cask or barrel, of indefinite contents; esp. one containing from 100 to 140 gallons.

hogsty - a pen, house, or inclosure, for hogs.

horrent - standing erect, as bristles; covered with bristling points; bristled; bristling.

horrid - fitted to excite horror; dreadful; hideous; shocking; hence, very offensive.
horridly - in a horrid manner.
horridness - the quality of being horrid.
horrific - causing horror; frightful.

horrifying - of horrify

horrisonant - horrisonous.
horrisonous - sounding dreadfully; uttering a terrible sound.
horror - that which excites horror or dread, or is horrible; gloom; dreariness.

hydrological - of or pertaining to hydrology.
hydrologist - one skilled in hydrology.
hydrology - the science of water, its properties, phenomena, and distribution over the earth's surface.
hydrolytic - tending to remove or separate water; eliminating water.
hydromagnesite - a hydrous carbonate of magnesia occurring in white, early, amorphous masses.
hydromancy - divination by means of water, -- practiced by the ancients.
hydromantic - of or pertaining to divination by water.
hydromedusae - of hydromedusa
hydromel - a liquor consisting of honey diluted in water, and after fermentation called mead.
hydromellonic - see cyamellone.
hydrometallurgy - the art or process of assaying or reducing ores by means of liquid reagents.
hydrometeorological - of or pertaining to hydrometeorology, or to rain, clouds, storms, etc.
hydrometric - alt. of hydrometrical
hydrometrical - made by means of an hydrometer; as, hydrometric observations.
hydrometry - the art or operation of measuring the velocity or discharge of running water, as in rivers, etc.
hydromica - a variety of potash mica containing water. it is less elastic than ordinary muscovite.
hydropath - a hydropathist.
hydropathic - alt. of hydropathical
hydropathical - of or pertaining to hydropathy.
hydropathist - one who practices hydropathy; a water-cure doctor.
hydroperitoneum - same as ascites.
hydrophane - a semitranslucent variety of opal that becomes translucent or transparent on immersion in water.
hydrophanous - made transparent by immersion in water.
hydrophlorone - a white, crystalline benzene derivative, c8h10o2, obtained by the reduction of phlorone.
hydrophobia - an abnormal dread of water, said to be a symptom of canine madness; hence:
hydrophoby - see hydrophobia.
hydrophora - the hydroidea.
hydrophyllia - of hydrophyllium
hydrophylliums - of hydrophyllium
hydrophyllium - one of the flat, leaflike, protective zooids, covering other zooids of certain siphonophora.
hydrophyte - an aquatic plant; an alga.
hydrophytology - the branch of botany which treats of water plants.
hydropic - alt. of hydropical
hydropical - dropsical, or resembling dropsy.
hydropically - in a hydropical manner.
hydropiper - a species (polygonum hydropiper) of knotweed with acrid foliage; water pepper; smartweed.
hydropsy - same as dropsy.
hydropult - a machine for throwing water by hand power, as a garden engine, a fire extinguisher, etc.
hydrorhizae - of hydrorhiza
hydrorhizas - of hydrorhiza
hydrosalt - a hydrous salt; a salt combined with water of hydration or crystallization.
hydroscope - an instrument designed to mark the presence of water, especially in air.
hydrosome - alt. of hydrosoma
hydrostat - a contrivance or apparatus to prevent the explosion of steam boilers.
hydrostatic - alt. of hydrostatical
hydrostatically - according to hydrostatics, or to hydrostatic principles.
hydrostatician - one who is versed or skilled in hydrostatics.
hydrosulphate - same as hydrosulphurent.
hydrosulphite - a saline compound of hydrosulphurous acid and a base.
hydrosulphuret - a hydrosulphide.
hydrosulphureted - combined with hydrogen sulphide.
hydrotellurate - a salt formed by the union of hydrotelluric acid and the base.
hydrotelluric - formed by hydrogen and tellurium; as, hydrotelluric acid, or hydrogen telluride.
hydrothecae - of hydrotheca
hydrothecas - of hydrotheca
hydrotherapy - see hydropathy.
hydrothorax - an accumulation of serous fluid in the cavity of the chest.
hydrotic - a hydrotic medicine.
hydrotical - hydrotic.
hydrotrope - a device for raising water by the direct action of steam; a pulsometer.
hydrotropic - turning or bending towards moisture, as roots.
hydrotropism - a tendency towards moisture.
hydrous - containing water of hydration or crystallization.
hydroxanthane - a persulphocyanate.
hydroxanthic - persulphocyanic.
hydrozoal - of or pertaining to the hydrozoa.
hydrozoa - of hydrozoon
hydrozoons - of hydrozoon
hydrozoon - one of the hydrozoa.
hydruret - a binary compound of hydrogen; a hydride.
hydrus - a constellation of the southern hemisphere, near the south pole.
hye - see hie.
hyemal - belonging to winter; done in winter.
hyemate - to pass the winter.
hyemation - the act of affording shelter in winter.
hyen - a hyena.

hyetographic - of or pertaining to to hyetography.
hyetography - the branch of physical science which treats of the geographical distribution of rain.

hygeist - one skilled in hygiena; a hygienist.
hygieist - a hygienist.
hygienic - of or pertaining to health or hygiene; sanitary.
hygienics - the science of health; hygiene.
hygienism - hygiene.
hygienist - one versed in hygiene.
hygiology - a treatise on, or the science of, the preservation of health.
hygrograph - an instrument for recording automatically the variations of the humidity of the atmosphere.
hygrology - the science which treats of the fluids of the body.
hygrometer - an instrument for measuring the degree of moisture of the atmosphere.
hygrometric - alt. of hygrometrical
hygrometrical - readily absorbing and retaining moisture; as, hygrometric substances, like potash.
hygrophanous - having such a structure as to be diaphanous when moist, and opaque when dry.
hygrophthalmic - serving to moisten the eye; -- sometimes applied to the lachrymal ducts.
hygrostatics - the science or art of comparing or measuring degrees of moisture.

hylarchical - presiding over matter.
hyleosaur - same as hylaeosaur.

hylicist - a philosopher who treats chiefly of matter; one who adopts or teaches hylism.
hylism - a theory which regards matter as the original principle of evil.
hylobate - any species of the genus hylobates; a gibbon, or long-armed ape. see gibbon.
hyloism - same as hylotheism.
hyloist - same as hylotheist.

hylopathist - one who believes in hylopathism.
hylophagous - eating green shoots, as certain insects do.
hylotheist - one who believes in hylotheism.

hymenium - the spore-bearing surface of certain fungi, as that on the gills of a mushroom.
hymenophore - that part of a fungus which is covered with the hymenium.
hymenopter - one of the hymenoptera.
hymenoptera - an extensive order of insects, including the bees, ants, ichneumons, sawflies, etc.

hyperapophysis - a lateral and backward-projecting process on the dorsal side of a vertebra.
hyperaspist - one who holds a shield over another; hence, a defender.

hyperbolist - one who uses hyperboles.
hyperbolized - of hyperbolize
hyperbolizing - of hyperbolize

hyperborean - an inhabitant of the most northern regions.
hypercarbureted - having an excessive proportion of carbonic acid; -- said of bicarbonates or acid carbonates.
hypercatalectic - having a syllable or two beyond measure; as, a hypercatalectic verse.
hyperchloric - see perchloric.
hyperchromatism - the condition of having an unusual intensity of color.
hypercritic - hypercritical.
hypercritical - excessively nice or exact.
hypercritically - in a hypercritical manner.

hypersecretion - morbid or excessive secretion, as in catarrh.

libertarianism - libertarian principles or doctrines.
liberticide - a destroyer of civil liberty.
libertinage - libertinism; license.
libertine - dissolute; licentious; profligate; loose in morals; as, libertine principles or manners.
libertinism - licentiousness of principle or opinion.

liberty - leave of absence; permission to go on shore.
libidinist - one given to lewdness.
libidinosity - the state or quality of being libidinous; libidinousness.

libkin - a house or lodging.

libra - a southern constellation between virgo and scorpio.
libral - of a pound weight.

library - a building or apartment appropriated for holding such a collection of books.

librating - of librate
librate - to poise; to balance.
libration - a real or apparent libratory motion, like that of a balance before coming to rest.
libratory - balancing; moving like a balance, as it tends to an equipoise or level.

librettos - of libretto

libretto - the words themselves.

national - attached to one's own country or nation.
nationalism - national independence; the principles of the nationalists.
nationalist - one who advocates national unity and independence; one of a party favoring irish independence.
nationalities - of nationality
nationality - existence as a distinct or individual nation; national unity and integrity.
nationalization - the act of nationalizing, or the state of being nationalized.
nationalized - of nationalize
nationalizing - of nationalize
nationally - in a national manner or way; as a nation.
nationalness - the quality or state of being national; nationality.
native - found in nature; not artificial; as native sodium chloride.
natively - by natural or original condition; naturally; originally.
nativeness - the quality or state of being native.
nativist - an advocate of nativism.
nativistic - relating to nativism.
nativies - of nativity
natka - a species of shrike.
natrium - the technical name for sodium.

natter - to find fault; to be peevish.
natterjack - a european toad (bufo calamita), having a yellow line along its back.
natty - neat; tidy; spruce.
natural - one born without the usual powers of reason or understanding; an idiot.
naturalism - a state of nature; conformity to nature.
naturalist - one who holds or maintains the doctrine of naturalism in religion.
naturalistic - closely resembling nature; realistic.
naturality - nature; naturalness.
naturalized - of naturalize
naturalizing - of naturalize
naturalize - to explain phenomena by natural agencies or laws, to the exclusion of the supernatural.
naturally - in a natural manner or way; according to the usual course of things; spontaneously.
naturalness - the state or quality of being natural; conformity to nature.
nature - to endow with natural qualities.
natureless - not in accordance with nature; unnatural.
naturism - the belief or doctrine that attributes everything to nature as a sanative agent.
naturist - one who believes in, or conforms to, the theory of naturism.
naturity - the quality or state of being produced by nature.
naturize - to endow with a nature or qualities; to refer to nature.

naufragous - causing shipwreck.

naughtly - naughtily; wrongly.
naughty - mischievous; perverse; froward; guilty of disobedient or improper conduct; as, a naughty child.

restive - uneasy; restless; averse to standing still; fidgeting about; -- applied especially to horses.
restless - not affording rest; as, a restless chair.
restorable - admitting of being restored; capable of being reclaimed; as, restorable land.

rhizanthous - producing flowers from a rootstock, or apparently from a root.
rhizine - a rootlike filament or hair growing from the stems of mosses or on lichens; a rhizoid.
rhizocarpous - having perennial rootstocks or bulbs, but annual flowering stems; -- said of all perennial herbs.
rhizodont - a reptile whose teeth are rooted in sockets, as the crocodile.
rhizogan - prodicing roots.
rhizoid - a rootlike appendage.
rhizomata - of rhizoma
rhizoma - same as rhizome.

rhizome - a rootstock. see rootstock.
rhizophaga - a division of marsupials. the wombat is the type.
rhizophagous - feeding on roots; root-eating.

rhizophorous - bearing roots.

russety - of a russet color; russet.

russify - to russianize; as, to russify conquered tribes.
russophile - alt. of russophilist
russophilist - one who, not being a russian, favors russian policy and aggrandizement.
russophobe - alt. of russophobist
russophobist - one who dreads russia or russian influence.
russophobia - morbid dread of russia or of russian influence.

ruttle - a rattling sound in the throat arising from difficulty of breathing; a rattle.
rutty - rooty.

sanders - an old name of sandalwood, now applied only to the red sandalwood. see under sandalwood.
sandever - see sandiver.
sandglass - an instrument for measuring time by the running of sand. see hourglass.
sandiness - the quality or state of being sandy, or of being of a sandy color.
sandish - approaching the nature of sand; loose; not compact.
sandix - a kind of minium, or red lead, made by calcining carbonate of lead, but inferior to true minium.
sandpaper - to smooth or polish with sandpaper; as, to sandpaper a door.
sandpiper - a small lamprey eel; the pride.

sanguinivorous - subsisting on blood.

sanguisuge - a bloodsucker, or leech.
sanguivorous - subsisting upon blood; -- said of certain blood-sucking bats and other animals. see vampire.

scrobicula - one of the smooth areas surrounding the tubercles of a sea urchin.
scrobicular - pertaining to, or surrounding, scrobiculae; as, scrobicular tubercles.
scrobiculate - alt. of scrobiculated
scrobiculated - having numerous small, shallow depressions or hollows; pitted.

scrode - a young codfish, especially when cut open on the back and dressed.

scrofulous - diseased or affected with scrofula.
scrog - a stunted shrub, bush, or branch.
scroggy - abounding in scrog; also, twisted; stunted.

scrolled - formed like a scroll; contained in a scroll; adorned with scrolls; as, scrolled work.

unableness - inability.
unabridged - not abridged, or shortened; full; complete; entire; whole.
unacceptability - the quality of being unacceptable; unacceptableness.
unacceptable - not acceptable; not pleasing; not welcome; unpleasant; disagreeable; displeasing; offensive.
unaccessible - inaccessible.
unaccomplished - not accomplished or performed; unfinished; also, deficient in accomplishment; unrefined.
unaccomplishment - the state of being unaccomplished.
unaccountability - the quality or state of being unaccountable.
unaccountable - not to be accounted for; inexplicable; not consonant with reason or rule; strange; mysterious.
unaccurate - inaccurate.
unaccurateness - inaccuracy.
unaccustomed - not usual; uncommon; strange; new.
unacquaintance - the quality or state of being unacquainted; want of acquaintance; ignorance.
unacquainted - not usual; unfamiliar; strange.
unacquaintedness - unacquaintance.
unactive - to render inactive or listless.
unactiveness - inactivity.
unadmissible - alt. of unadmittable
unadmittable - inadmissible.
unadulterate - alt. of unadulterated
unadulterated - not adulterated; pure.
unadvisable - not advisable; inadvisable; inexpedient.
unadvised - done without due consideration; wanton; rash; inconsiderate; as, an unadvised proceeding.
unaffected - free from affectation; plain; simple; natural; real; sincere; genuine; as, unaffected sorrow.
unafiled - undefiled.
unagreeable - not agreeing or consistent; unsuitable.
unaidable - incapable of being aided.
unalienable - inalienable; as, unalienable rights.
unalist - an ecclesiastical who holds but one benefice; -- distinguished from pluralist.
unallied - not allied; having no ally; having no connection or relation; as, unallied species or genera.
unalmsed - not having received alms.
unambiguity - absence of ambiguity; clearness; perspicuity.
unambition - the absence of ambition.
unamiability - the quality or state of being unamiable; moroseness.
unamiable - not amiable; morose; ill-natured; repulsive.
unanchor - to loose from the anchor, as a ship.
unaneled - not aneled; not having received extreme unction.
unanimate - unanimous.
unanimity - the quality or state of being unanimous.
unanswerability - the quality of being unanswerable; unanswerableness.
unanswerable - not answerable; irrefutable; conclusive; decisive; as, he have an unanswerable argument.
unanswered - not responded to in kind; unrequited; as, unanswered affection.
unappalled - not appalled; not frightened; dauntless; undaunted.
unapparel - to divest of clothing; to strip.
unappealable - not to be appealed from; -- said of a judge or a judgment that can not be overruled.
unappliable - inapplicable.
unapplicable - inapplicable.
unappropriate - not appropriated.
unappropriated - not specially appropriate; having not special application.
unapproved - not proved.
unapt - not accustomed and not likely; not disposed.
unaquit - unrequited.
unargued - not censured.
unarm - to puff off, or lay down, one's arms or armor.
unarmed - having no hard and sharp projections, as spines, prickles, spurs, claws, etc.
unarted - not artificial; plain; simple.
unartful - lacking art or skill; artless.
unartistic - inartistic.
unascried - not descried.
unaserved - not served.
unassured - not insured against loss; as, unassured goods.
unatonable - incapable of being atoned for; inexpiable.
unattached - not taken or arrested.
unattentive - inattentive; careless.
unattire - to divest of attire; to undress.
unaudienced - not given an audience; not received or heard.
unauspicious - inauspicious.
unauthorize - to disown the authority of; to repudiate.
unavoidable - not voidable; incapable of being made null or void.
unavoided - unavoidable; inevitable.
unaware - unawares.
unawares - without design or preparation; suddenly; without premeditation, unexpectedly.
unbacked - not supported or encouraged; not countenanced; unaided.
unbag - to pour, or take, or let go, out of a bag or bags.
unbalanced - not balanced; not in equipoise; having no counterpoise, or having insufficient counterpoise.
unballast - not ballasted.
unballasted - freed from ballast; having discharged ballast.
unbaned - wanting a band or string; unfastened.
unbank - to remove a bank from; to open by, or as if by, the removal of a bank.

unbarbed - destitute of bards, or of reversed points, hairs, or plumes; as, an unbarded feather.

undercoat - a growth of short hair or fur partially concealed by a longer growth; as, a dog's undercoat.
underconduct - a lower conduit; a subterranean conduit.
underconsumption - consumption of less than is produced; consumption of less than the usual amount.
undercraft - a sly trick or device; as, an undercraft of authors.

undercurrent - running beneath the surface; hidden.
undercut - to cut away, as the side of an object, so as to leave an overhanging portion.

underground - beneath the surface of the earth.

underlaid - laid or placed underneath; also, having something laid or lying underneath.
underlay - the inclination of a vein, fault, or lode from the vertical; a hade; -- called also underlie.
underlayer - a perpendicular shaft sunk to cut the lode at any required depth.
underleaf - a prolific sort of apple, good for cider.
underlet - to let or lease at second hand; to sublet.
underletter - a tenant or lessee who grants a lease to another.
underlie - see underlay, n., 1.
underline - to influence secretly.
underling - an inferior person or agent; a subordinate; hence, a mean, sorry fellow.
underlip - the lower lip.
underlock - a lock of wool hanging under the belly of a sheep.
underlocker - a person who inspects a mine daily; -- called also underviewer.
undermanned - insufficiently furnished with men; short-handed.
undermasted - having masts smaller than the usual dimension; -- said of vessels.
undermaster - a master subordinate to the principal master; an assistant master.
undermatch - one who is not a match for another.
undermeal - the inferior, or after, part of the day; the afternoon.
underminer - one who undermines.

underministry - a subordinate or inferior ministry.
undermirth - suppressed or concealed mirth.
undermoneyed - bribed.
undermost - lowest, as in place, rank, or condition.
underneath - under; beneath; below.

universities - of university
university - an association, society, guild, or corporation, esp. one capable of having and acquiring property.
universological - of or pertaining to universology.
universologist - one who is versed in universology.
universology - the science of the universe, and the relations which it involves.
univocacy - the quality or state of being univocal.
univocal - a word having but one meaning.
univocally - in a univocal manner; in one term; in one sense; not equivocally.
univocation - agreement of name and meaning.
unjoin - to disjoin.
unjoint - to disjoint.
unjointed - having no joint or articulation; as, an unjointed stem.
unjustice - want of justice; injustice.
unkard - see unked.
unked - lonely; dreary; unkard.
unkemmed - unkempt.
unkempt - fig.; not smoothed; unpolished; rough.
unkennel - fig.: to discover; to disclose.
unkent - unknown; strange.
unketh - uncouth.
unkind - not kind; contrary to nature, or the law of kind or kindred; unnatural.
unkindliness - unkindness.
unkindly - unfavorable; annoying; malignant.
unkindred - not kindred; not of the same kin.
unking - to cause to cease to be a king.
unkingship - the quality or condition of being unkinged; abolition of monarchy.
unkiss - to cancel or annul what was done or sealed by a kiss; to cancel by a kiss.
unkle - see uncle.
unknight - to deprive of knighthood.
unknit - to undo or unravel what is knitted together.
unknot - to free from knots; to untie.
unknow - unknown.
unknowledged - not acknowledged or recognized.
unknown - not known; not apprehended.
unlabored - not laboriously produced, or not evincing labor; as, an unlabored style or work.
unlace - to loose the dress of; to undress; hence, to expose; to disgrace.
unlade - to unload; to remove, or to have removed, as a load or a burden; to discharge.
unlaid - not laid out, as a corpse.
unland - to deprive of lands.
unlap - to unfold.
unlash - to loose, as that which is lashed or tied down.
unlatched - of unlatch
unlatching - of unlatch
unlatch - to open or loose by lifting the latch; as, to unlatch a door.
unlaugh - to recall, as former laughter.
unlaw - a fine imposed as a penalty for violation of the law.
unlawed - not having the claws and balls of the forefeet cut off; -- said of dogs.
unlawful - not lawful; contrary to law.
unlawlike - not according to law; being or done in violation of law; unlawful.
unlay - to untwist; as, to unlay a rope.
unlearn - to fail to learn.
unlearned - not exhibiting learning; as, unlearned verses.
unleash - to free from a leash, or as from a leash; to let go; to release; as, to unleash dogs.
unleavened - not leavened; containing no leaven; as, unleavened bread.
unlicked - not licked; hence, not properly formed; ungainly.cf. to lick into shape, under lick, v.
unlike - not likely; improbable; unlikely.
unlikelihood - absence of likelihood.
unlikeliness - the quality or state of being unlikely.
unlikely - in an unlikely manner.
unliken - to make unlike; to dissimilate.
unlikeness - the quality or state of being unlike; want of resemblance; dissimilarity.
unlimber - to detach the limber from; as, to unlimber a gun.
unlimitable - illimitable.
unlimited - unconfined; not restrained; unrestricted.
unline - to take the lining out of; hence, to empty; as, to unline one's purse.
unlink - to separate or undo, as links; to uncoil; to unfasten.
unliquidated - not liquidated; not exactly ascertained; not adjusted or settled.
unliquored - not in liquor; not intoxicated; sober.
unlive - to //ve in a contrary manner, as a life; to live in a manner contrary to.
unlived - bereft or deprived of life.
unload - to perform the act of unloading anything; as, let unload now.
unloader - one who, or that which, unloads; a device for unloading, as hay from a wagon.
unlocated - not located or placed; not fixed in a place.
unlock - to open, in general; to lay open; to undo.
unlodge - to dislodge; to deprive of lodgment.
unlook - to recall or retract, as a look.
unlooked - not observed or foreseen; unexpected; -- generally with for.
unloose - to become unfastened; to lose all connection or union.
unloosen - to loosen; to unloose.
unlord - to deprive of the rank or position of a lord.
unlorded - not raised to the rank of a lord.
unlove - to cease to love; to hate.
unluckily - in an unlucky manner.
unluckiness - quality or state of being unlucky.
unlucky - mischievous; as, an unlucky wag.
unlust - listlessness; disinclination.
unlute - to separate, as things cemented or luted; to take the lute or the clay from.
unmade - deprived of form, character, etc.; disunited.
unmagistrate - to divest of the office or authority of a magistrate.
unmaiden - to ravish; to deflower.
unmake - to destroy the form and qualities of; to deprive of being; to uncreate.
unman - to deprive of men; as, to unman a ship.
unmanacle - to free from manacles.
unmanhood - absence or lack of manhood.
unmanned - not furnished with men; as, an unmanned ship.
unmannerly - uncivilly; rudely.

unmasterable - incapable of being mastered or subdued.
unmaterial - not material; immaterial.
unmeaning - not indicating intelligence or sense; senseless; expressionless; as, an unmeaning face.
unmeant - not meant or intended; unintentional.
unmeasurable - immeasurable.

unmechanized - not mechanized.
unmeet - not meet or fit; not proper; unbecoming; unsuitable; -- usually followed by for.
unmember - to deprive of membership, as in a church.
unmentionables - the breeches; trousers.
unmerchantable - not merchantable; not fit for market; being of a kind, quality, or quantity that is unsalable.

unmerciful - not merciful; indisposed to mercy or grace; cruel; inhuman; merciless; unkind.
unmerciless - utterly merciless.

unmitre - to deprive of a miter; to depose or degrade from the rank of a bishop.

unmould - to change the form of; to reduce from any form.

unmoor - to weigh anchor.
unmoralized - not restrained or tutored by morality.
unmorrised - not arrayed in the dress of a morris dancer.

unmothered - deprived of a mother; motherless.

unstrained - not forced; easy; natural; as, a unstrained deduction or inference.
unstrength - want of strength; weakness; feebleness.
unstriated - nonstriated; unstriped.
unstring - used also figuratively; as, his nerves were unstrung by fear.
unstriped - without marks or striations; nonstriated; as, unstriped muscle fibers.
unstudied - not spent in study.

unsucceedable - not able or likely to succeed.

unsufferable - insufferable.

unsured - not made sure.

unswayable - not capable of being swayed.
unswear - to recall an oath.
unsweat - to relieve from perspiration; to ease or cool after exercise or toil.
unswell - to sink from a swollen state; to subside.
unsymmetrical - being without symmetry of chemical structure or relation; as, an unsymmetrical carbon atom.
unsymmetrically - not symmetrically.
unsympathy - absence or lack of sympathy.
untack - to separate, as what is tacked; to disjoin; to release.
untackle - to unbitch; to unharness.
untalked - not talked; not mentioned; -- often with of.
untangibility - intangibility.
untangible - intangible.
untangibly - intangibly.
untangle - to loose from tangles or intricacy; to disentangle; to resolve; as, to untangle thread.
untappice - to come out of concealment.
untaste - to deprive of a taste for a thing.
unteach - to cause to be forgotten; as, to unteach what has been learned.
unteam - to unyoke a team from.
untemper - to deprive of temper, or of the proper degree of temper; to make soft.
untemperate - intemperate.
untemperately - intemperately.
untempter - one who does not tempt, or is not a tempter.
untenant - to remove a tenant from.
untent - to bring out of a tent.
untented - not tended; not dressed. see 4th tent.
unthank - no thanks; ill will; misfortune.
unthink - to recall or take back, as something thought.
unthinker - a person who does not think, or does not think wisely.
unthinking - not indicating thought or reflection; thoughtless.
unthread - to make one's way through; to traverse; as, to unthread a devious path.
untrift - an unthrifty.
unthrift - unthrifty.
unthriftfully - not thriftily.
unthriftihead - alt. of unthriftihood
unthriftihood - untriftiness.
unthriftily - improperly; unbecomingly.
unthriftiness - the quality or state or being unthrifty; profuseness; lavishness.
unthrifty - not thrifty; profuse.
unthrone - to remove from, or as from, a throne; to dethrone.
untidy - not tidy or neat; slovenly.
untie - to become untied or loosed.
untighten - to make less tight or tense; to loosen.
until - as far as; to the place or degree that; especially, up to the time that; till. see till, conj.
untile - to take the tiles from; to uncover by removing the tiles.
untime - an unseasonable time.
untimeliness - unseasonableness.
untimely - out of the natural or usual time; inopportunely; prematurely; unseasonably.
untimeous - untimely.
untimeously - untimely; unseasonably.
untithed - not subjected tithes.
untitled - being without title or right; not entitled.
unto - until; till.
untold - not numbered or counted; as, untold money.
untolerable - intolerable.
untomb - to take from the tomb; to exhume; to disinter.
untongue - to deprive of a tongue, or of voice.
untooth - to take out the teeth of.
untoward - inconvenient; troublesome; vexatious; unlucky; unfortunate; as, an untoward wind or accident.
untowardly - perverse; froward; untoward.
untraded - not traded in or bartered; hence, not hackneyed; unusual; not common.
untrained - not trainable; indocile.
untrammeled - not hampered or impeded; free.
untraveled - not traveled; not trodden by passengers; as, an untraveled forest.
untread - to tread back; to retrace.
untreasure - to bring forth or give up, as things previously treasured.
untreasured - not treasured; not kept as treasure.
untreatable - incapable of being treated; not practicable.
untrenched - being without trenches; whole; intact.
untressed - not tied up in tresses; unarranged; -- said of the hair.
untrowable - incredible.
untrue - untruly.
untruism - something not true; a false statement.
untrunked - separated from its trunk or stock.
untruss - alt. of untrusser
untrusser - one who untrussed persons for the purpose of flogging them; a public whipper.
untrust - distrust.
untrustful - not to be trusted; not trusty.
untruthful - not truthful; unveracious; contrary to the truth or the fact.
untuck - to unfold or undo, as a tuck; to release from a tuck or fold.
untune - to make incapable of harmony, or of harmonious action; to put out of tune.
unturn - to turn in a reserve way, especially so as to open something; as, to unturn a key.
unturned - not turned; not revolved or reversed.
untwain - to rend in twain; to tear in two.

unty - to untie.

unused - not habituated; unaccustomed.

unwarm - to lose warmth; to grow cold.

unwarped - not warped; hence, not biased; impartial.

unwary - unexpected; unforeseen; unware.
unwashed - not washed or cleansed; filthy; unclean.
unwashen - not washed.
unwayed - having no ways or roads; pathless.

youthly - young; youthful.
youthsome - youthful.
youthy - young.
youze - the cheetah.
yow - you.
yowe - a ewe.
yowl - a loud, protracted, and mournful cry, as that of a dog; a howl.
yowley - the european yellow-hammer.
yox - see yex.
ypight - see pight.
ypocras - hippocras.
ypsiloid - in the form of the letter y; y-shaped.
yraft - bereft.
yren - iron.
yronne - run.
ysame - together.
yt - alt. of yt
ythrowe - p. p. of throw.
ytterbic - pertaining to, or derived from, ytterbium; containing ytterbium.
yttria - the oxide, y2o3, or earth, of yttrium.
yttric - pertaining to, derived from, or containing, yttrium.
yttrious - same as yttric.
yu - jade.
yucca - see flicker, n., 2.
yuck - to scratch.
yuckel - same as yockel.
yufts - russia leather.
yug - alt. of yuga
yuke - same as yuck.
yule - christmas or christmastide; the feast of the nativity of our savior.
yuletide - christmas time; christmastide; the season of christmas.
yunx - a genus of birds comprising the wrynecks.
yupon - same as yaupon.
yux - see yex, n.
yvel - evil; ill.
ywar - aware; wary.
ywis - certainly; most likely; truly; probably.
zabaism - alt. of zabism
zabism - see sabianism.
zabian - see sabian.
zacco - see zocco.
zaerthe - same as z/rthe.
zaim - a turkish chief who supports a mounted militia bearing the same name.
zaimet - a district from which a zaim draws his revenue.
zain - a horse of a dark color, neither gray nor white, and having no spots.
zalambdodont - one of the zalambdodonta. the tenrec, solenodon, and golden moles are examples.
zambos - of zambo
zamindary - alt. of zamindari
zamindari - the jurisdiction of a zamindar; the land possessed by a zamindar.
zamite - a fossil cycad of the genus zamia.
zampogna - a sort of bagpipe formerly in use among italian peasants. it is now almost obsolete.
zandmole - the sand mole.
zante - see zantewood.
zantewood - satinwood (chloroxylon swietenia).
zantiot - a native or inhabitant of zante, one of the ionian islands.
zanies - of zany
zany - to mimic.
zanyism - state or character of a zany; buffoonery.
zaphara - zaffer.
zapotilla - see sapodilla.
zaptiah - a turkish policeman.
zarathustrian - alt. of zarathustric
zarathustric - of or pertaining to zarathustra, or zoroaster; zoroastrian.
zarathustrism - see zoroastrianism.
zareba - an improvised stockade; especially, one made of thorn bushes, etc.
zarnich - native sulphide of arsenic, including sandarach, or realgar, and orpiment.
zarthe - a european bream (abramis vimba).
zax - a tool for trimming and puncturing roofing slates.
zayat - a public shed, or portico, for travelers, worshipers, etc.
zeal - to be zealous.
zealant - one who is zealous; a zealot; an enthusiast.
zealed - full of zeal; characterized by zeal.
zealful - full of zeal.
zealless - wanting zeal.
zealotical - like, or suitable to, a zealot; ardently zealous.
zealotism - the character or conduct of a zealot; zealotry.
zealotist - a zealot.
zealotry - the character and behavior of a zealot; excess of zeal; fanatical devotion to a cause.
zealous - filled with religious zeal.
zebec - see xebec.
zebrawood - the wood of an east indian tree of the genus guettarda.
zebrine - pertaining to, or resembling, the zebra.
zebub - a large noxious fly of abyssinia, which like the tsetse fly, is destructive to cattle.
zechin - see sequin.
zechstein - the upper division of the permian (dyas) of europe. the prevailing rock is a magnesian limestone.
zed - the letter z; -- called also zee, and formerly izzard.
zeekoe - a hippopotamus.
zehner - an austrian silver coin equal to ten kreutzers, or about five cents.
zemindar - same as zamindar.
zemindary - alt. of zemindari
zemindari - same as zamindary.
zenana - the part of a dwelling appropriated to women.
zenik - see zenick.
zenithal - of or pertaining to the zenith.
zeolitic - of or pertaining to a zeolite; consisting of, or resembling, a zeolite.
zeolitiform - having the form of a zeolite.
zephyr - the west wind; poetically, any soft, gentle breeze.
zequin - see sequin.
zerda - the fennec.
zeriba - same as zareba.
zeros - of zero
zeroes - of zero
zero - fig.: the lowest point; the point of exhaustion; as, his patience had nearly reached zero.
zest - to give a relish or flavor to; to heighten the taste or relish of; as, to zest wine.
zested - of zest
zesting - of zest
zeta - a greek lettercorresponding to our z.
zetetic - a seeker; -- a name adopted by some of the pyrrhonists.
zetetics - a branch of algebra which relates to the direct search for unknown quantities.
zeuglodont - any species of zeuglodonta.
zeuglodonta - same as phocodontia.
zeugmatic - of or pertaining to zeugma; characterized by zeugma.
zeugobranchiata - same as zygobranchia.
zeylanite - see ceylanite.
zibet - alt. of zibeth
ziega - curd produced from milk by adding acetic acid, after rennet has ceased to cause coagulation.
zietrisikite - a mineral wax, vert similar to ozocerite. it is found at zietrisika, moldavia, whence its name.
zif - the second month of the jewish ecclesiastical year, corresponding to our may.
zigger - alt. of zighyr
zighyr - same as sicker.
zigzag - to move in a zigzag manner; also, to have a zigzag shape.
zigzagged - of zigzag
zigzagging - of zigzag
zigzaggery - the quality or state of being zigzag; crookedness.
zigzaggy - having sharp turns.
zillah - a district or local division, as of a province.
zincked - of zinc
zinced - of zinc
zincking - alt. of zincing
zincing - the act or process of applying zinc; galvanization.
zinc - to coat with zinc; to galvanize.
zincane - zinc chloride.
zincic - pertaining to, containing, or resembling, zinc; zincous.
zincide - a binary compound of zinc.
zinciferous - containing or affording zinc.
zincify - to coat or impregnate with zinc.
zincky - pertaining to zinc, or having its appearance.
zincode - the positive electrode of an electrolytic cell; anode.
zincographer - an engraver on zinc.
zincongraphic - alt. of zincongraphical
zincongraphical - of or pertaining to zincography; as, zincographic processes.
zincous - of or pertaining to the positive pole of a galvanic battery; electro-positive.
zingari - of zingaro
zingaro - a gypsy.
zink - see zinc.
zinkenite - a steel-gray metallic mineral, a sulphide of antimony and lead.
zinky - see zincky.
